00105 float CNProbeSet::getSignalContrast(double dK)
00106 {
00107   if ((m_fAAlleleSignal + m_fBAlleleSignal) == 0) {
00108     throw(Except("Zero median signals found. CEL file may be corrupted."));
00109   }
00110   float fContrast = (float)(sinh(dK * (m_fAAlleleSignal - m_fBAlleleSignal) / (m_fAAlleleSignal + m_fBAlleleSignal)) / sinh(dK));
00111   if (fabs(fContrast) > 1) {
00112     throw(Except("Can't have abs(contrast) > 1."));
00113   }
00114   return fContrast;
00115 }
00116 
00117 float CNProbeSet::getSignalContrastMvA()
00118 {
00119   const double eps = 0.001;
00120   if (m_fAAlleleSignal < eps)
00121       m_fAAlleleSignal = eps;
00122   if (m_fBAlleleSignal < eps)
00123       m_fBAlleleSignal = eps;
00124 
00125   return log2(m_fBAlleleSignal) - log2(m_fAAlleleSignal);
00126 }
00127 
00128 float CNProbeSet::getSignalStrength()
00129 {
00130   if ((m_fAAlleleSignal + m_fBAlleleSignal) == 0) {
00131     throw(Except("Zero median signals found. CEL file may be corrupted."));
00132   }
00133   return log2(m_fAAlleleSignal + m_fBAlleleSignal);
00134 }
00135 
00136 float CNProbeSet::getSignalStrengthMvA()
00137 {
00138   const double eps = 0.001;
00139   if (m_fAAlleleSignal < eps)
00140       m_fAAlleleSignal = eps;
00141   if (m_fBAlleleSignal < eps)
00142       m_fBAlleleSignal = eps;
00143 
00144   return (log2(m_fAAlleleSignal) + log2(m_fBAlleleSignal))/2.0;
00145 }
00146 
00147 float CNProbeSet::getIntensityContrast(double dK)
00148 {
00149   if ((m_fAMedianIntensity + m_fBMedianIntensity) == 0) {
00150     throw(Except("Zero median intensities found. CEL file may be corrupted."));
00151   }
00152   float fContrast = (float)(sinh(dK * (m_fAMedianIntensity - m_fBMedianIntensity) / (m_fAMedianIntensity + m_fBMedianIntensity)) / sinh(dK));
00153   if (fabs(fContrast) > 1) {
00154     throw(Except("Can't have abs(contrast) > 1."));
00155   }
00156   return fContrast;
00157 }
00158 
00159 float CNProbeSet::getIntensityStrength()
00160 {
00161   if ((m_fAMedianIntensity + m_fBMedianIntensity) == 0) {
00162     throw(Except("Zero median intensities found. CEL file may be corrupted."));
00163   }
00164   return log2(m_fAMedianIntensity + m_fBMedianIntensity);
00165 }

00167 float CNProbeSet::getCalibratedLog2Ratio(
00168   double dAlphaCNCalibrate,
00169   double dBetaCNCalibrate)
00170 //  Sacrifice a bit of compiler optimization for readability.  Commented out
00171 //  is the original code for reference.
00172 //  {
00173 //  return (float)exp(((getLog2Ratio() / dAlphaCNCalibrate) + dBetaCNCalibrate) * log(2.0));}
00174 {
00175   double log2ratio = getLog2Ratio();
00176   log2ratio /= dAlphaCNCalibrate;
00177   log2ratio += dBetaCNCalibrate;
00178   return (float)exp(log2ratio*log(2.0));
00179 }
00180 
00181 float CNProbeSet::getCalibratedSmoothedLog2Ratio(
00182   double dAlphaCNCalibrate,
00183   double dBetaCNCalibrate)
00184 //  Sacrifice a bit of compiler optimization for readability.  Commented out
00185 //  is the original code for reference.
00186 //  {
00187 //  return (float)exp(((getLog2Ratio() / dAlphaCNCalibrate) + dBetaCNCalibrate) * log(2.0));}
00188 {
00189   double log2ratio = getSmoothedLog2Ratio();
00190   log2ratio /= dAlphaCNCalibrate;
00191   log2ratio += dBetaCNCalibrate;
00192   return (float)exp(log2ratio*log(2.0));
00193 }
00194 
00195 /**
00196  * Compare function.
00197  * @param that - A reference to an instance of this class.
00198  * @param iCompareCode - The code to switch on when doing compares. (Each code is a different compare.)
00199  * @return - int value. (-1 if *this < that, 0 if *this == that, 1 if *this > that)
00200 */
00201 int CNProbeSet::compareTo(CNProbeSet& that, int iCompareCode)
00202 {
00203   int iCompareResult = 0;
00204   switch (iCompareCode) {
00205   case 0:
00206     //iCompareResult = m_strProbeSetName.compareTo(that.m_strProbeSetName, 0);
00207     iCompareResult = strcmp(m_strProbeSetName.c_str(), that.m_strProbeSetName.c_str());
00208     break;
00209   case 1:
00210     iCompareResult = AffxArray<char>::compare(m_cChromosome, that.m_cChromosome);
00211     if (iCompareResult == 0) {
00212       iCompareResult = AffxArray<int>::compare(m_iPosition, that.m_iPosition);
00213     }
00214     //if (iCompareResult == 0) {iCompareResult = m_strProbeSetName.compareTo(that.m_strProbeSetName, 0);}
00215     if (iCompareResult == 0) {
00216       iCompareResult = strcmp(m_strProbeSetName.c_str(), that.m_strProbeSetName.c_str());
00217     }
00218     break;
00219   }
00220   return iCompareResult;
00221 }

00223 /**
00224  * @brief Return the CNNeutral call (0 or 1)
00225  * @param int - The sex code for this sample.
00226  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the X chromosome
00227  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the Y chromosome
00228  * @return char - The call
00229  */
00230 char CNProbeSet::getCNNeutral(int iSexCode, int iXChromosome, int iYChromosome)
00231 {
00232 //  return ((m_iCNState == 2) ? 1 : 0);
00233   return (((getCNGain(iSexCode, iXChromosome, iYChromosome) == 0) && (getCNLoss(iSexCode, iXChromosome, iYChromosome) == 0)) ? (char)1 : (char)0);
00234 }
00235 
00236 /**
00237  * @brief Return the CNGain call (0 or 1)
00238  * @param int - The sex code for this sample.
00239  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the X chromosome
00240  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the Y chromosome
00241  * @return char - The call
00242  */
00243 char CNProbeSet::getCNGain(int iSexCode, int iXChromosome, int iYChromosome)
00244 {
00245 //  return ((m_iCNState > 2) ? 1 : 0);
00246   char cCNGain = 0;
00247   if ((m_cChromosome == iXChromosome) && (!m_bPseudoAutosomalRegion)) {
00248     if (iSexCode == affx::Male) {
00249       if (m_iCNState > 1) {
00250         cCNGain = 1;
00251       }
00252     } else {
00253       if (m_iCNState > 2) {
00254         cCNGain = 1;
00255       }
00256     }
00257   } else if ((m_cChromosome == iYChromosome) && (!m_bPseudoAutosomalRegion)) {
00258     if (iSexCode == affx::Male) {
00259       if (m_iCNState > 1) {
00260         cCNGain = 1;
00261       }
00262     } else {
00263       if (m_iCNState > 0) {
00264         cCNGain = 1;
00265       }
00266     }
00267   } else {
00268     if (m_iCNState > 2) {
00269       cCNGain = 1;
00270     }
00271   }
00272   return cCNGain;
00273 }

00275 /**
00276  * @brief Return the CNLoss call (0 or 1)
00277  * @param int - The sex code for this sample.
00278  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the X chromosome
00279  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the Y chromosome
00280  * @return char - The call
00281  */
00282 char CNProbeSet::getCNLoss(int iSexCode, int iXChromosome, int iYChromosome)
00283 {
00284 //  return ((m_iCNState < 2) ? 1 : 0);
00285   char cCNLoss = 0;
00286   if ((m_cChromosome == iXChromosome) && (!m_bPseudoAutosomalRegion)) {
00287     if (iSexCode == affx::Male) {
00288       if (m_iCNState < 1) {
00289         cCNLoss = 1;
00290       }
00291     } else {
00292       if (m_iCNState < 2) {
00293         cCNLoss = 1;
00294       }
00295     }
00296   } else if ((m_cChromosome == iYChromosome) && (!m_bPseudoAutosomalRegion)) {
00297     if (iSexCode == affx::Male) {
00298       if (m_iCNState < 1) {
00299         cCNLoss = 1;
00300       }
00301     } else {
00302       cCNLoss = 0;
00303 //    if (m_iCNState < 0) {cCNLoss = 1;}
00304     }
00305   } else {
00306     if (m_iCNState < 2) {
00307       cCNLoss = 1;
00308     }
00309   }
00310   return cCNLoss;
00311 }

00313 /**
00314  * @brief Return the CNNeutralLOH call (0 or 1)
00315  * @param int - The sex code for this sample.
00316  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the X chromosome
00317  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the Y chromosome
00318  * @return char - The call
00319  */
00320 char CNProbeSet::getCNNeutralLOH(int iSexCode, int iXChromosome, int iYChromosome)
00321 {
00322   //char cCNNeutral = getCNNeutral(iSexCode, iXChromosome, iYChromosome);
00323   // Always assume CNNeutral is CN == 2, per Jim and Carl 02/18/2009
00324   return (((m_iCNState == 2) && (m_fLoh == 1)) ? (char)1 : (char)0);
00325 }
00326 
00327 /**
00328  * @brief Return the NormalDipload call (0 or 1)
00329  * @param int - The sex code for this sample.
00330  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the X chromosome
00331  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the Y chromosome
00332  * @return char - The call
00333  */
00334 char CNProbeSet::getNormalDiploid(int iSexCode, int iXChromosome, int iYChromosome)
00335 {
00336   //char cCNNeutral = getCNNeutral(iSexCode, iXChromosome, iYChromosome);
00337   // Always assume CNNeutral is CN == 2, per Jim and Carl 02/18/2009
00338   return (((m_iCNState == 2) && (m_fLoh == 0)) ? (char)1 : (char)0);
00339 }
00340 
00341 /**
00342  * @brief Return the specified segment type call
00343  * @param int - The segment type code
00344  * @param int - The sex code for this sample
00345  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the X chromosome
00346  * @param int - The numeric value associated with the Y chromosome
00347  * @return char - The call
00348  */
00349 char CNProbeSet::getSegmentTypeCall(int iSegmentType, int iSexCode, int iXChromosome, int iYChromosome)
00350 {
00351   char cCall = -1;
00352   switch (iSegmentType) {
00353   case 1:
00354     cCall = getCNState();
00355     break;
00356   case 2:
00357     cCall = ((getLoh() == 1) ? (char)1 : (char)0);
00358     break;
00359   case 3:
00360     cCall = ((getLoh() == 1) ? (char)1 : (char)0);
00361     break;
00362   case 4:
00363     cCall = getCNNeutralLOH(iSexCode, iXChromosome, iYChromosome);
00364     break;
00365   case 5:
00366     cCall = getNormalDiploid(iSexCode, iXChromosome, iYChromosome);
00367     break;
00368   }
00369   return cCall;
00370 }

00372 /**
00373  * @brief Return the specified segment type confidence
00374  * @param int - The segment type code
00375  * @return float - The comnfidence
00376  */
00377 float CNProbeSet::getSegmentTypeConfidence(int iSegmentType)
00378 {
00379   float fConfidence = 0;
00380   switch (iSegmentType) {
00381   case 1:
00382     fConfidence = getCNConfidence();
00383     break;
00384   }
00385   return fConfidence;
00386 }

00393 /**
00394  * @brief Return the affx genotype call code
00395  * @return char - The call
00396  */
00397 char CNProbeSet::getGenotypeCallCode()
00398 {
00399   switch (m_cGenotypeCall) {
00400   case 0: return ALLELE_A_CALL; break;
00401   case 1: return ALLELE_AB_CALL; break;
00402   case 2: return ALLELE_B_CALL; break;
00403   default: return ALLELE_NO_CALL;
00404   }
00405   return ALLELE_NO_CALL;
00406 }
00407 
00408 void CNProbeSet::setCovariateValue(int index, float value)
00409 {
00410     if (m_vAllCovariates.size() <= index)
00411     {
00412         int oldSize = m_vAllCovariates.size();
00413 
00414         // swap trick to force the capacity equal EXACTLY to index+1 (which resize() does not do!)
00415         m_vAllCovariates.resize(index+1);
00416         std::vector<float>(m_vAllCovariates).swap(m_vAllCovariates);
00417 
00418         // pad the gap (if any) with NaNs
00419         for (int i = oldSize; i < index; i++)
00420         {
00421             m_vAllCovariates[i] = numeric_limits<float>::quiet_NaN();
00422         }
00423     }
00424     m_vAllCovariates[index] = value;
00425 }

00433 bool CNProbeSetArray::isSketchSubset()
00434 {
00435   unsigned int uiCount = 0;
00436   for (int iIndex = 0; (iIndex < getCount()); iIndex++) {
00437     CNProbeSet* p = getAt(iIndex);
00438     if (p->isUseForSketch()) {
00439       uiCount++;
00440     }
00441   }
00442   return (uiCount == getCount());
00443 }
00444 int CNProbeSetArray::getCNProcessCount()
00445 {
00446   unsigned int uiCount = 0;
00447   for (int iIndex = 0; (iIndex < getCount()); iIndex++) {
00448     CNProbeSet* p = getAt(iIndex);
00449     if (p->isProcess() && p->processAsCN()) {
00450       uiCount++;
00451     }
00452   }
00453   return uiCount;
00454 }

00457 int CNProbeSetArray::getProcessCount()
00458 {
00459   unsigned int uiCount = 0;
00460   for (int iIndex = 0; (iIndex < getCount()); iIndex++) {
00461     CNProbeSet* p = getAt(iIndex);
00462     if (p->isProcess() ) {
00463       uiCount++;
00464     }
00465   }
00466   return uiCount;
00467 }
00468 
00469 void CNProbeSetArray::calculateLog2RatioMedianSmooth(int iWindowSize)
00470 {
00471   if ((iWindowSize % 2) == 0) {
00472     iWindowSize++;
00473   } // Window size should be odd.
00474   if (getCount() < iWindowSize) {
00475     return;
00476   }
00477   int iHalfWindow = (int)(iWindowSize / 2);
00478   AffxMultiDimensionalArray<float> v(iWindowSize);
00479   for (int iIndex = iHalfWindow; (iIndex < (getCount() - iHalfWindow)); iIndex++) {
00480     int j = 0;
00481     for (int i = (iIndex - iHalfWindow); (i <= (iIndex + iHalfWindow)); i++) {
00482       v.set(j, getAt(i)->getLog2Ratio()); j++;
00483     }
00484     getAt(iIndex)->setLog2RatioMedianSmooth(v.median());
00485   }
00486   for (int iIndex = (iHalfWindow - 1); (iIndex >= 0); iIndex--) {
00487     getAt(iIndex)->setLog2RatioMedianSmooth(getAt(iIndex + 1)->getLog2RatioMedianSmooth());
00488   }
00489   for (int iIndex = (getCount() - iHalfWindow); (iIndex < getCount()); iIndex++) {
00490     getAt(iIndex)->setLog2RatioMedianSmooth(getAt(iIndex - 1)->getLog2RatioMedianSmooth());
00491   }
00492 }
00493 
00494 void CNProbeSetArray::setupGCCorrectionBins(int iGCBinCount)
00495 {
00496   AffxMultiDimensionalArray<float> vGcContent(getProcessCount());
00497   int iIndex = 0;
00498   for (int iRowIndex = 0; (iRowIndex < getCount()); iRowIndex++) {
00499     CNProbeSet* p = getAt(iRowIndex);
00500     if (!p->isProcess() || !( p->processAsCN() || p->processAsSNP() )) {
00501       continue;
00502     }
00503     float fGcContent = p->getGCContent();
00504     vGcContent.set(iIndex, fGcContent);
00505     iIndex++;
00506   }
00507   AffxMultiDimensionalArray<float> v(iGCBinCount);
00508   AffxMultiDimensionalArray<int> vCounts(iGCBinCount);
00509   float fPercentile = 0;
00510   for (int iBinIndex = 0; (iBinIndex < iGCBinCount); iBinIndex++) {
00511     fPercentile = vGcContent.percentile((1.0 / (double)iGCBinCount) * (iBinIndex + 1));
00512     v.set(iBinIndex, fPercentile);
00513   }
00514   v.set((iGCBinCount - 1), 1);
00515   for (int iRowIndex = 0; (iRowIndex < getCount()); iRowIndex++) {
00516     CNProbeSet* pobjProbeSet = getAt(iRowIndex);
00517     if (!pobjProbeSet->isProcess() || !( pobjProbeSet->processAsCN() || pobjProbeSet->processAsSNP() )) {
00518       continue;
00519     }
00520     float fGcContent = pobjProbeSet->getGCContent();
00521     for (int iBinIndex = 0; (iBinIndex < iGCBinCount); iBinIndex++) {
00522       if (fGcContent <= v.get(iBinIndex)) {
00523         if (iBinIndex == 0) {
00524           pobjProbeSet->setGCBinIndex(iBinIndex);
00525           vCounts.increment(iBinIndex);
00526           break;
00527         } else if (fGcContent > v.get(iBinIndex - 1)) {
00528           pobjProbeSet->setGCBinIndex(iBinIndex);
00529           vCounts.increment(iBinIndex);
00530           break;
00531         }
00532       }
00533     }
00534     if (pobjProbeSet->getGCBinIndex() == -1) {
00535       Verbose::out(1, pobjProbeSet->getProbeSetName() + " has no gc-bin assignment. " + ::getDouble(fGcContent, 6));
00536     }
00537   }
00538   /*
00539   Verbose::out(1, "*");
00540   AffxString str;
00541   for (int iBinIndex = 0; (iBinIndex < iGCBinCount); iBinIndex++)
00542   {
00543    if (iBinIndex == 0)
00544    {
00545     Verbose::out(1, str + "GC Correction Bin " + ::getInt(iBinIndex + 1) + "\t= 0       \t<= n <= " + ::getDouble(v.get(iBinIndex), 6) + "\tMarkerCount = " + ::getInt(vCounts.get(iBinIndex)));
00546    }
00547    else if (iBinIndex == (iGCBinCount - 1))
00548    {
00549     Verbose::out(1, str + "GC Correction Bin " + ::getInt(iBinIndex + 1) + "\t= " + ::getDouble(v.get(iBinIndex - 1), 6) + "\t<  n <= 1       \tMarkerCount = " + ::getInt(vCounts.get(iBinIndex)));
00550    }
00551    else
00552    {
00553     Verbose::out(1, str + "GC Correction Bin " + ::getInt(iBinIndex + 1) + "\t= " + ::getDouble(v.get(iBinIndex - 1), 6) + "\t<  n <= " + ::getDouble(v.get(iBinIndex), 6) + "\tMarkerCount = " + ::getInt(vCounts.get(iBinIndex)));
00554    }
00555   }
00556   Verbose::out(1, "*");
00557   */
00558 }
